step_feedback.feedback: For step 1, try to keep your shoulders and elbows more stable. Focus on opening your fingers wide as instructed.
In step 2, aim for greater consistency in your arm and wrist movements. Ensure your shoulder blades are squeezed together as you push down.
For step 3, pay close attention to your wrist alignment. Try to maintain a more consistent form throughout the movement.
In step 4, focus on smooth arm extension overhead and controlled exhalation. Work on keeping your elbows and wrists more aligned.
For step 5, ensure your arms are fully stretched overhead and your fingers are open. Aim for more consistent elbow and wrist positioning.

exercise_summary: You're doing a great job with the Push Down Pumping exercise! Remember to stretch your arms overhead with open fingers and then make a fist while squeezing your shoulder blades. Keep up the good work!
